H0.text: what form of government does australia use. Constitutional Monarchy

H1.text: what form of government does australia use. Parliamentary Democracy

H2.text: what form of government does australia use. Representative Democracy

H3.text: what form of government does australia use. Federation

A4.text: The Australian Government is the national executive government of Australia, a federal parliamentary constitutional monarchy.

A5.text: The prime minister is a role which exists by constitutional convention, rather than by law.

A6.text: It is a written constitution, which establishes the country as a federation under a constitutional monarchy governed with a parliamentary system.

A7.text: Its eight chapters set down the structure and powers of the three constituent parts of the federal level of government: the Parliament, the Executive Government and the Judicature.
